summary: Website about the science of blue light effects on circadian rhythm (authored/credited to PushpakSaha and Md. Zawraiz Khan).

existing_features.title: Create a responsive, science-focused informational website that explains the effects of blue light on circadian rhythm, written in clear English for a general audience.

Include structured content sections covering: (1) what blue light is (wavelength range and common sources), (2) how circadian rhythm and melatonin work at a high level, (3) mechanisms of blue light impact (ipRGCs/melanopsin and alerting effects), (4) evidence summary (what research generally shows and typical findings), (5) practical mitigation strategies (evening lighting, screen settings, timing, environment), and (6) cautions/limitations (individual differences, brightness/duration, not medical advice).
Add a clear author/credit area that attributes the site to both names exactly as provided: "PushpakSaha" and "Md. Zawraiz Khan".

Implement basic site navigation for a single-page experience (scroll-to sections) or a small set of routes (e.g., Home, Science, Tips, References/About), ensuring users can quickly reach each major section.

Add a references section with a short, readable bibliography-style list of credible sources (e.g., review articles, academic/medical institutions). Do not claim or fabricate specific study outcomes beyond the high-level summary presented on the page.

Choose and apply a coherent visual theme suitable for a science education website (color palette, typography, spacing, and component styles) and enforce it consistently across all pages/sections. Avoid defaulting to a blue/purple theme.

Generate and include static visual assets to support the educational content, stored under frontend/public/assets/generated, and render them in the relevant sections of the site (do not serve images via the backend).
